wikipedia_page.main: George David William Smith FRS, FIMMM, FInstP, FRSC, CEng (b. 1943, in Aldershot, Hampshire) is a materials scientist with special interest in the study of the microstructure, composition and properties of engineering materials at the atomic level. He invented, together with Alfred Cerezo and Terry Godfrey, the Atom-Probe Tomograph in 1988.

response: * 1988 — Alfred Cerezo, Terence Godfrey, and George D. W. Smith applied a position-sensitive detector to the atom probe, making it able to resolve materials in 3-dimensions with near-atomic resolution.
*George D. W. Smith (born 1943), materials scientist, co-invented the atom probe tomograph
* George D. W. Smith - materials scientist

|2020 ||George D. W. Smith ||"for pioneering and leading the development of engineering alloys through the invention and application of the three-dimensional atom probe, making profound contributions to basic understanding and industrial applications."||
* George D. W. Smith (born 1943), materials scientist
*George D. W. Smith, materials scientist, was born in Aldershot
